intro: Jasione umbellata, commonly known as the common jasione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to Europe and parts of western Asia, it thrives in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
